results.title: Les Cavaliers de L'orage = the Horsemen of the Storm
results.creator_credit: Gerard Vergez and Tarak Ben Ammar
results.brief_description:
Always accompanied by his brother Ange, Jason is a fine rider and wrestling champion. He supplies horses to the local army captain, Castaing. Castaing is married to Marie, a doctor. When WWI breaks out, the two brothers enlist and are sent off to the Balkans where they meet up with Marie again. She has just lost her husband and works in a military hospital. Jealousy rears its ugly head and the brothers start to compete for her favor. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1984: Best music for Michel Portal.

Credits: Producer, Tarak ben Ammar ; director, Gerard Vergez ; writers, Gerard Vergez, Daniel Boulanger ; photography, Andre Diot ; music, Michel Portal.
Cast: Marlene Jobert, Gerard Klein, Vittorio Mezzogiorno, Wadeck Stanczak, Hanns Zischler.

results.title: Les Camisards = the French Calvinists
results.brief_description:
Les Camisards’ brings events to the screen from the period in which King Louis XIV revoked the Act on Religious Tolerance (1685) and ordered French Protestants to convert to Catholicism or face persecutions. Rather than being a sweeping epic, this film examines the fight of a small group of Protestants for survival in the mountainous Cevennes region. Some of the story is told using excerpts from the diary kept by an actual participant in the conflict. The movie is notable for its period authenticity and historical accuracy.

Credits: Director, Rene Allio ; writers, Jean Jourdheuil, Rene Allio ; photography, Denys Clairval ; music, Philippe Arthuys.
Cast: Francois Marthouret, Dominique Labourier, Rufus, Isabelle Sadoyan, Jacques Debary, Genevieve Mnich, Maurice Benichou, Suzy Rambaud, Jean Benguigui, Christine Laurent.

results.title: Les Bonnes Femmes = the Good Girls
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Raymond Hakim and Robert Hakim
results.brief_description:
Four shop girls long to escape the monotony of their existence: Ginette sings in a tatty music-hall; Rita drifts into a bourgeois marriage; Jane simply wants a good time; Jacqueline yearns for romantic love but is strangled by a maniac. Chabrol’s early masterpiece offers a gallery of grotesques, macabre and farcical humour, but also poetry and tenderness. The mixture of compassion for the girls and contempt for their dreams created an ironic structure that disturbed the majority of critics when it first appeared.

Credits: Producer, Robert and Raymond Hakim ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writers, Claude Chabrol, Paul Gegauff ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Paul Misraki, Pierre Jansen.
Cast: Bernadette Lafont, Stephane Audran, Clotilde Joano, Lucile Saint-Simon, Ave Ninchi, Mario David, Sacha Briquet, Claude Berri.

results.title: Les Belles de Nuit = Beauties of the Night
results.brief_description:
Claude, an impoverished music teacher, lives a life of boredom in a small provincial town. His lovely young neighbour seems smitten, but he has little time for her. Each sound he hears or every person he meets begets a new fancy. He dreams himself a conquering hero, a musketeer, or a soldier of the French Revolution, but always the conquerer of delicious women. The conflict between waking and dream worlds leads to amusing, strange, even fantastic situations. Which world will prevail?

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre ; director, Rene Clair ; writer, Rene Clair, Pierre Barrillet, Jean-Pierre Gredy ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Georges van Parys ; art direction, Leon Barsacq ; costumes, Rosine Delamare ; assistant director, Mic
Cast: Gerard Philipe, Gina Lollobrigida, Jean Paredes, Martine carol, Raymond Bussieres, Magali de Vendeuil, Bernard Lajarrigue, Marylin Bufferd, Pierre Palau, Jane Pierson.

results.title: Les Beaux souvenirs
results.creator_credit: Francis Maikiewiez, Jean Dansereau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A middle-class wife leaves her husband with two young daughters. Through a series of occasional flash-backs, a contrast is made between the seemingly happy family relationship when the girls were young and the shattered threesome in later years. Starring Monique Spaziani, Julie Vincent and Paul Herbert.

results.title: Les Aventures de Salavin = the Adventures of Salavin
results.brief_description:
The Salavin cycle describes the frustrations and perplexities of a ‘little man’ of the 20th century trying to work out his own salvation with no religious faith to sustain him.

Credits: Producer, Edgar Roulleau ; director, Pierre Granier-Deferre ; writers, Pierre Granier-Deferre, R. M. Arland ; photography, Rene Bucaille ; music, Claude Bolling.
Cast: Maurice Biraud, Christiane Minazzoli, Mona Dol, Genevieve Fontanel, Julien Carette.

results.title: Les Annees Folles = the Crazy Years
results.brief_description:
The Roaring Twenties (The Crazy Years) were a time of carefree living, unbridled creativity and political upheaval. This documentary is a made up of a compilation of newsreels from the archives of Pathe and Gaumont.

Credits: Directors, Henri Torrent, Mirea Alexandresco ; music, Georges Van Parys, Georges Tzipine ; narration, Serge Reggiani.

results.title: Les Anges du Peche = Angels of the Streets
results.creator_credit: Robert Bresson, Roland Tual and Dominique Drouin
results.brief_description:
Filmed during WWII, Robert Bresson’s first feature was shot entirely at night. Establishing a precedent that he would follow in his later films, Bresson utilises non-professionals in the leading roles. Rich young Anne-Marie thinks she has found her vocation when she joins a Dominican convent as a novice. The convent specialises in rehabilitating female prisoners, and Anne-Marie becomes especially fascinated with Therese, trying to get her to join the convent to redeem her for her sins - but Therese protests her innocence and refuses the offer. Upon her release, Therese kills her lover, and seeks refuge from the police in Anne-Marie’s convent. Further reading: Paul Schrader, “Transcendental Style in Film : Ozu, Bresson, Dreyer”, DaCapo, 1988. Further reading: Film Comment. ‘Special Bresson’. May/June and July 1999

Credits: Producers, Dominique Drouin, Roland Tual ; director, Robert Bresson ; writers, Jean Giraudoux, (Rev. Pere) Raymond Leopold Bruckberger, Robert Bresson ; photography, Philippe Agostini ; music, Jean-Jacques Grunenwald.
Cast: Renee Faure, Jany Holt, Sylvie, Marie-Helene Daste, Silvia Monfort, Mila Parely, Louis Seigner.
